name: centric
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
central, or having a centre: There are two opposing centric forces that may well be irreconcilable. Transfers of income and property within the family may be centric or non-centric.
anatomy
  specialized relating to a nerve centre (= a group of nerves with a particular function)
medical
  specialized used by dentists to describe the way a person's upper and lower teeth come together in their mouth: Your chewing muscles can play a major role in allowing your joints to move symmetrically into the centric relation position. Centric occlusion is a functional relationship of the teeth.
More examplesFewer examplesThere are two basic shapes: pennate, which is elongated, or centric, which is round.More than 25 different types of centric fusion have been identified so far. What we are really trying to do is engage a community that has a centric interest in efficient and effective dialogue.
